intro: Melandrium taquetii var. album, commonly known as the white bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and its distinctive, inflated, seed-containing pods. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and roadsides. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
